scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of States/UTs Police Personnel
description: The Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) for the Wards of States/UTs Police Personnel is a scholarship scheme introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India, in the academic session 2019-20. It aims to encourage higher technical and professional education for dependent wards of States/UTs Police Personnel martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks. A total of 500 scholarships are awarded annually, equally divided between boys and girls.
benefits: Scholarship amount: ₹3,000/- per month for girls (₹36,000/- annually).
Scholarship amount: ₹2,500/- per month for boys (₹30,000/- annually).
Duration: Up to 5 years, depending on the course duration and regulatory body approval.
eligibility: Dependent wards of States/UTs Police Personnel martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks.

Pursuing first professional degree programs in fields like Engineering, Medicine, Dental, Veterinary, BBA, BCA, B. Pharma, B.Sc (Nursing, Agriculture, etc.), MBA, and MCA, recognized by AICTE, MCI, or UGC.
New applicants must have a minimum of 60% marks in their Minimum Entry Qualification (MEQ) (10+2/Diploma/Graduation or equivalent).
Renewal applicants must pass each subsequent academic year with a minimum of 50% marks.
A one-year grace period is allowed for delayed renewal applications.
Admissible for only two children per family.
Marital status does not affect eligibility.
Wards admitted to the 2nd year of technical/professional Bachelor Degree Courses (e.g., BE/B. Tech) through lateral entry after completing Diploma courses are eligible.
Only full-time, regular professional courses are eligible; correspondence/distance learning courses are excluded.
Applicants should not be availing benefits from other scholarship schemes, stipends, or financial assistance.
Applicants must not have previously availed the PMSS scholarship (except for renewal).
Courses must lead to a degree; diploma courses not leading to a degree are excluded, as are master's degree programs except MBA/MCA if they are the first professional course.

Applicants must be admitted to colleges/institutes/universities approved under the UGC Act, recognized by AICTE, or approved by MCI (for medical courses), with NBA accredited courses for engineering degrees.
Applicants must be studying in India (studying abroad is excluded).
Change of course/college after selection will lead to scholarship rejection.
documents: Certificate from the State Govt. confirming the Police personnel was killed in terror/naxal violence.
Attested scanned copy of Mark sheet for Minimum Entry Qualification (MEQ) (XII/Diploma/Graduation or equivalent).
Bank account details (preferably Aadhaar-seeded nationalized bank account).
Certificate issued by the educational institution (for renewal applicants).
Any other relevant documents as required.
